articles.headline: Mine safety stories
articles.summary: Journalists utilized computer-assisted reporting techniques to investigate mine safety in the wake of the Sago Mine disaster, leveraging data from the U.S. Mine Safety and Health Administration.

articles.headline: Data lifts lid on DeLay money
articles.summary: Analysis of financial contributions and ethics violations reveals insights into the influence and power held by Rep. Tom DeLay in Congress.

articles.headline: Advanced GIS analysis targets lost wetlands
articles.summary: A GIS-based investigation discovers large-scale loss of wetlands in Florida, underscoring the failure of federal commitments to protect these critical areas.

articles.headline: Campus crime
articles.author_title: NICAR and Missouri School of Journalism
articles.summary: An analysis of campus crime statistics highlights the University of Massachusetts as having the highest rate of violent crime, prompting discussions on safety measures.

articles.headline: Simplifying database full-text searches
articles.summary: Introduction of OpenInfo, a tool for intranet-based full-text search across newsroom databases, offering a cost-effective and efficient solution for data access.
